Description: Opening price at the start of a trading period
Highest price in a trading period
Lowest price in a trading period
Total volume in a trading period
Closing price at the end of a trading period

A simple moving average (SMA) calculates the average of a selected range of prices, usually closing prices, by the number of periods in that range. In this case, we are using the 20 periods moving average.

The relative strength index (RSI) is a momentum indicator used in technical analysis that measures the magnitude of recent price changes to evaluate overbought or oversold conditions in the price of a stock or other asset.
The Momentum indicator is a measurement of the acceleration and deceleration of prices. It indicates if prices are increasing at an increasing rate or decreasing at a decreasing rate.
On-balance volume (OBV), a momentum indicator that measures positive and negative volume flow.
Average true range (ATR) is a market volatility indicator used in technical analysis. It is typically derived from the 14-day simple moving average of a series of true range indicators.
An ordinal feature to represent analyst's recommendations. 0=bad, 5=good
A numerical feature based on VADER sentimental analysis scoring metric
